chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

Embark on the next chapter of the rustic adventures of young Canadian chef/owners Craig Harding and Rob Rossi as they head for the rugged countryside and towering mountain ranges of Argentina. From the Pampas to the peaks of the Andes they’ll find endless culinary inspiration to bring back home to Canada.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.

Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!

Lidia’s Italy in America brings viewers on a road trip into the heart of Italian‐American cooking. Lidia Bastianich goes across the US to talk with fishermen, chefs, farmers, butchers, families, and entrepreneurs to learn more about the rich and diverse development of Italian‐American culture.

Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.

Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location

title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.

Follow 7 rookie estate agents as they put everything on the line to sell some of the most impressive and exclusive properties in the UK - from Scottish castles to penthouse apartments, seaside mansions to gated estates.

Incredible Homes features Ireland’s most popular Television architect Dermot Bannon. In this series, Dermot visits some stunning and unusual homes across the Globe from London to Australia. On his busman’s holiday, Dermot meets homeowners, architects and realtors who show him award-winning homes and introduce him to some incredible living spaces and experiences.

This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Every country has its own flavour, shaped by the local produce, culture, history and bakers that spend their lives making what for many, is a foundation of their diets.

With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.

A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

This new TLN original documentary series follows celebrated chef and writer Sang Kim on a culinary road trip across his home province. Over the course of six half-hour episodes, Sang travels to meet a colourful, multi-generational cast of Korean Canadians, each with their own unique perspectives and recipes to share.

Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.

Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

David Rocco’s Dolce Africa tells the lesser-known stories of the world’s oldest continent. From ancient tribal villages and rural working farms, to breathtaking natural parks and big bustling cities, David explores the rich and diverse cultures and culinary worlds of Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar and South Africa with curiosity, an open heart and an open mind. By fully immersing himself and the viewer in the sights, sounds and tastes of Africa, David shatters our preconceived notions of a continent that’s struggling to survive, and instead paints a picture of an Africa that is strong, proud and beautiful — the Africa of the future.

Neven Maguire travels from Venice on the Adriatic Coast, to Sorrento on the Mediterranean, visiting Parma, Modena, Florence and Tuscany. Along the way, Ireland’s hugely popular chef learns about some of the wonderful food and drink that have made Italian cuisine so popular around the world, including parmesan cheese, pasta, Parma ham, Prosecco, olive oil, coffee and Chianti. Neven enjoys street food beside a race track, he is shown how to cook the perfect risotto by a Michelin star chef, and he is taught how to make the perfect cappuccino by Italy’s champion barista.

And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.

Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.

106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!

In Silvia’s Italian Masterclass we are offered an intimate insight into Silvia’s kitchen, who loves nothing more than to share what she has learnt along the way, so that you too can muster the beauty of simple, Italian homecooking.

A bounty hunter learns that his next target is his ex-wife, a reporter working on a murder cover-up. Soon after their reunion, the always-at-odds duo find themselves on a run-for-their-lives adventure.

After moving his family back to his hometown to be with his friends and their kids, Lenny finds out that between old bullies, new bullies, schizo bus drivers, drunk cops on skis, and four hundred costumed party crashers sometimes crazy follows you.

Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
Donal Skehan shows viewers how to cook healthy, delicious recipes designed to help us get active, fuel fitness activities, and even embark on adventure sports.

Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location

title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.

title: Tastes Like Home With Catherine Fulvio

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Six incredible cities, twelve emotive families and food cooked with a passion is the recipe for this year's fourth season of Tastes Like Home with Catherine Fulvio.

Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.

title: Gente Da Nossa With Nellie Pedro

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Gente da Nossa is a vibrant and engaging weekly Portuguese-language magazine-style show hosted by Nellie Pedro. Airing every Saturday morning on TLN TV, the program serves as a comprehensive and captivating window into the world of Portuguese culture, society, and current affairs captivating its audience by offering thought-provoking interviews with prominent figures in politics, religion, and business, alongside conversations with the most popular entertainers in Portugal. The show provides an insightful and diverse perspective on Portugal through weekly segments shot on location, offering viewers a firsthand look at various aspects of the country. Additionally, Gente da Nossa includes a community bulletin segment, informing audiences about upcoming events and activities happening within the local community.

title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

Open Fire is a rustic outdoor cooking series featuring acclaimed Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding creating delicious, innovative dishes over multiple fires. The series spans all four seasons as the Chefs heat things up in the fresh days of spring through to the crisp cold of snowbound winter.

title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.

The new season of The Chef’s Bar is a celebration of Canada’s incredible food diversity and a chance for viewers to taste the true north! Featuring food inspired from eight provinces and two territories. It will give viewers an epic front row seat into incredibly mouth watering dishes featuring all Canadian ingredients

Amazing food and great conversation are served up in the new series Silvia's Italian Table featuring Australian actress, opera singer, author and chef Silvia Colloca. Joined by a diverse and eclectic group of celebrity guests including former Olympians Ian Thorpe, Duchess of York Sarah Ferguson, renowned journalist and presenter George Negus, acclaimed chef Matt Moran and actress Marta Dusseldorp,  Silvia shares her personal memories and inspiration behind each mouth-watering dish and visits some of the most stunning parts of Italy.
Relive the goals and highlights from the previous round of Serie A in this 30 minute recap show.

With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.

This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.

title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Join Diane as she travels throughout Greece and its islands, where she explores many of the foods that Greece is known for (olive oil, feta, honey, yogurt and more), and discovers the country's traditions. Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.

The final chapter in the “Opening” series features Canadian chefs (and best friends) Rob Rossi and Craig Harding travelling to the island of Sicily for their next culinary adventure. The ancient crossroads of the Mediterranean, this gorgeous island has a dazzling diversity of landscapes and cultural treasures. It also boasts its very own style of traditional Italian cuisine and an increasingly vibrant wine scene.

TLN celebrity chef David Rocco welcomes viewers into his home kitchen in the newest installment of the Dolce series on TLN TV. “Dolce Homemade,” showcases David celebrating multicultural Canada by connecting with friends and family through candid conversations and inspiring recipes. Featuring guests from around the world who share David’s passion for both food and life, the new series brings his adventurous spirit home.

On his busman’s holiday, Dermot meets homeowners, architects and realtors who show him award-winning homes and introduce him to some incredible living spaces and experiences.

"Le Ciociare" delves deep into a shadowed chapter of World War II, illuminating the harrowing experiences of Italian women who endured brutal violations at the hands of the Goumiers soldiers following the Battle of Cassino. Through intimate testimonies of the last surviving victims, archival footage, and expert analysis, this powerful documentary seeks to give voice to the silent sufferers of history, revealing the heartbreaking paradox of liberation that came at an unthinkable personal cost. The story underscores the complex tapestry of war, where liberators can also be oppressors, and heroes may hide dark secrets.

This documentary tells the story of the historic Battle of Monte Cassino, one of the most important military operations of World War II through the eyes of the last surviving Italian immigrants, who fled war-torn Italy for Canada. Their accounts, while only being children at the time, are infused with on-location visuals of the mountain and the abbey that rests at its peak.

title: San Pietro Infine: The Forgotten City

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: San Pietro Infine is a small town in the Province of Caserta which endured bitter fighting in December 1943. Untouched for 75 years, the gates to a forgotten city will be opened and the last living Italian-Canadian survivors will recount the significant battle of San Pietro Infine. With testimonials from back home in Canada and the exclusive access to this city already granted to our production team, San Pietro Infine: Una Cittá Perduta will be an important addition to TLN Media Group’s “I Remember” series which chronicles and captures the firsthand accounts of Italian-Canadians as children of war during WWII. Other projects in this series have included: Operazione Husky, Montecassino: L’Abbazia Indestruttibile and Ortona: La Stalingrado Canadese.
Hardworking mom Allyson has a crazy night out with her friends, while their husbands watch their children.

A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

This new TLN original documentary series follows celebrated chef and writer Sang Kim on a culinary road trip across his home province. Over the course of six half-hour episodes, Sang travels to meet a colourful, multi-generational cast of Korean Canadians, each with their own unique perspectives and recipes to share.

Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.

title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Join Diane as she travels throughout Greece and its islands, where she explores many of the foods that Greece is known for (olive oil, feta, honey, yogurt and more), and discovers the country's traditions. Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.

title: Tastes Like Home With Catherine Fulvio

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Six incredible cities, twelve emotive families and food cooked with a passion is the recipe for this year's fourth season of Tastes Like Home with Catherine Fulvio.

Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.

Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

Celebrate tastes of the true north with Opening Canada. Join celebrity chef duo Rob Rossi and Craig Harding as they eat their way across their home and native land making stops in The Laurentians, Montreal, Toronto, Saskatoon, the Blue Mountains, Whitehorse and Vancouver to celebrate Canada’s diverse food culture from coast to coast.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location

title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

Open Fire is a rustic outdoor cooking series featuring acclaimed Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding creating delicious, innovative dishes over multiple fires. The series spans all four seasons as the Chefs heat things up in the fresh days of spring through to the crisp cold of snowbound winter.

David Rocco’s Dolce Africa tells the lesser-known stories of the world’s oldest continent. From ancient tribal villages and rural working farms, to breathtaking natural parks and big bustling cities, David explores the rich and diverse cultures and culinary worlds of Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar and South Africa with curiosity, an open heart and an open mind. By fully immersing himself and the viewer in the sights, sounds and tastes of Africa, David shatters our preconceived notions of a continent that’s struggling to survive, and instead paints a picture of an Africa that is strong, proud and beautiful — the Africa of the future.

Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.

title: Tastes Like Home With Catherine Fulvio

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Six incredible cities, twelve emotive families and food cooked with a passion is the recipe for this year's fourth season of Tastes Like Home with Catherine Fulvio.

Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.

Among them are actors Jeffrey Wright, Sigourney Weaver, Melissa McCarthy, and Sterling K. Brown, ground-breaking director Jordan Peele, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, acclaimed journalists Gayle King and Norah O’Donnell, musicians Queen Latifah and Jon Batiste. Legendary fashion designers Diane von Furstenberg, Narciso Rodriguez, and Zac Posen. As well as a host of other luminaries, including Jeff Goldblum, Anjelica Huston, Isabella Rossellini, Terry Gross, Marc Maron, Eric Stonestreet, Issa Rae, Amy Ryan, and Justina Machado. Some of the guests whose stories we will revisit this season include actors Scarlett Johansson, Julianne Moore, and Marisa Tomei, journalist Lisa Ling, radio talk-show host Joe Madison, musician Questlove, and late-night comedian Jimmy Kimmel.

Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.

The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.

Embark on the next chapter of the rustic adventures of young Canadian chef/owners Craig Harding and Rob Rossi as they head for the rugged countryside and towering mountain ranges of Argentina. From the Pampas to the peaks of the Andes they’ll find endless culinary inspiration to bring back home to Canada.

The final chapter in the “Opening” series features Canadian chefs (and best friends) Rob Rossi and Craig Harding travelling to the island of Sicily for their next culinary adventure. The ancient crossroads of the Mediterranean, this gorgeous island has a dazzling diversity of landscapes and cultural treasures. It also boasts its very own style of traditional Italian cuisine and an increasingly vibrant wine scene.

TLN celebrity chef David Rocco welcomes viewers into his home kitchen in the newest installment of the Dolce series on TLN TV. “Dolce Homemade,” showcases David celebrating multicultural Canada by connecting with friends and family through candid conversations and inspiring recipes. Featuring guests from around the world who share David’s passion for both food and life, the new series brings his adventurous spirit home.

The Ontario Business Achievement Awards (OBAAs) is one of the most distinguished industry celebrations recognizing business success in the province. For the fifth consecutive year, the 2024 OBAAs will continue as a television broadcast in six back-to-back episodes, highlighting our business community’s unwavering strength and adaptability in the face of macroeconomic challenges.

Incredible Homes features Ireland’s most popular Television architect Dermot Bannon. In this series, Dermot visits some stunning and unusual homes across the Globe from London to Australia. On his busman’s holiday, Dermot meets homeowners, architects and realtors who show him award-winning homes and introduce him to some incredible living spaces and experiences.

title: Dark Horses: Italy’s 2006 World Cup Triumph

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: A docuseries that follows the Italian national football team’s spectacular redemption story in 2006, as they came back from the worst scandal in their history to defeat rivals France and win the World Cup.

With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.

Follow 7 rookie estate agents as they put everything on the line to sell some of the most impressive and exclusive properties in the UK - from Scottish castles to penthouse apartments, seaside mansions to gated estates.

Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.

In Silvia’s Italian Masterclass we are offered an intimate insight into Silvia’s kitchen, who loves nothing more than to share what she has learnt along the way, so that you too can muster the beauty of simple, Italian homecooking.

This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Every country has its own flavour, shaped by the local produce, culture, history and bakers that spend their lives making what for many, is a foundation of their diets.

Hollywood actor Ray Winstone takes a trip around Sicily with some old friends, soaking up the island's multicultural history, ancient culture and colourful inhabitants. His Grand Tour explores all the island has to offer - from the top of Mount Etna, to the palace of a Duchess in Palermo, to Agrigento's Valley of the Temples, and more!
Elisa's teenage years in Rome, when she formed a special friendship with a quarrelsome classmate, which compensated somewhat for trouble with maladjusted parents.
A female gunfighter returns to a frontier town where a dueling tournament is being held, which she enters in an effort to avenge her father's death.

title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.

title: Charlie Luxton's Homes By The Med

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Architectural designer Charlie Luxton travels from Spain in the west to Greece in the east, exploring this diverse region’s fascinating architecture. He gets hands on to experience life as a local and of course meets the lucky people with truly amazing Homes by the Med.

Among them are actors Jeffrey Wright, Sigourney Weaver, Melissa McCarthy, and Sterling K. Brown, ground-breaking director Jordan Peele, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, acclaimed journalists Gayle King and Norah O’Donnell, musicians Queen Latifah and Jon Batiste. Some of the guests whose stories we will revisit this season include actors Scarlett Johansson, Julianne Moore, and Marisa Tomei, journalist Lisa Ling, radio talk-show host Joe Madison, musician Questlove, and late-night comedian Jimmy Kimmel.
Donal Skehan shows viewers how to cook healthy, delicious recipes designed to help us get active, fuel fitness activities, and even embark on adventure sports.

A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.

Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

Embark on the next chapter of the rustic adventures of young Canadian chef/owners Craig Harding and Rob Rossi as they head for the rugged countryside and towering mountain ranges of Argentina. From the Pampas to the peaks of the Andes they’ll find endless culinary inspiration to bring back home to Canada.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.

106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!

Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!

Incredible Homes features Ireland’s most popular Television architect Dermot Bannon. In this series, Dermot visits some stunning and unusual homes across the Globe from London to Australia. On his busman’s holiday, Dermot meets homeowners, architects and realtors who show him award-winning homes and introduce him to some incredible living spaces and experiences.

Follow 7 rookie estate agents as they put everything on the line to sell some of the most impressive and exclusive properties in the UK - from Scottish castles to penthouse apartments, seaside mansions to gated estates.

A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.

Brown, ground-breaking director Jordan Peele, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, acclaimed journalists Gayle King and Norah O’Donnell, musicians Queen Latifah and Jon Batiste. Legendary fashion designers Diane von Furstenberg, Narciso Rodriguez, and Zac Posen. As well as a host of other luminaries, including Jeff Goldblum, Anjelica Huston, Isabella Rossellini, Terry Gross, Marc Maron, Eric Stonestreet, Issa Rae, Amy Ryan, and Justina Machado. Some of the guests whose stories we will revisit this season include actors Scarlett Johansson, Julianne Moore, and Marisa Tomei, journalist Lisa Ling, radio talk-show host Joe Madison, musician Questlove, and late-night comedian Jimmy Kimmel.
Donal Skehan shows viewers how to cook healthy, delicious recipes designed to help us get active, fuel fitness activities, and even embark on adventure sports.

Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.

Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location

title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

Lyndey has organized to take Blair on a road trip through the Peloponnese to showcase firsthand all this captivating region has to offer.

Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

Open Fire is a rustic outdoor cooking series featuring acclaimed Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding creating delicious, innovative dishes over multiple fires. The series spans all four seasons as the Chefs heat things up in the fresh days of spring through to the crisp cold of snowbound winter.

David Rocco’s Dolce Africa tells the lesser-known stories of the world’s oldest continent. From ancient tribal villages and rural working farms, to breathtaking natural parks and big bustling cities, David explores the rich and diverse cultures and culinary worlds of Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar and South Africa with curiosity, an open heart and an open mind. By fully immersing himself and the viewer in the sights, sounds and tastes of Africa, David shatters our preconceived notions of a continent that’s struggling to survive, and instead paints a picture of an Africa that is strong, proud and beautiful — the Africa of the future.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!

Neven Maguire travels from Venice on the Adriatic Coast, to Sorrento on the Mediterranean, visiting Parma, Modena, Florence and Tuscany. Along the way, Ireland’s hugely popular chef learns about some of the wonderful food and drink that have made Italian cuisine so popular around the world, including parmesan cheese, pasta, Parma ham, Prosecco, olive oil, coffee and Chianti. Neven enjoys street food beside a race track, he is shown how to cook the perfect risotto by a Michelin star chef, and he is taught how to make the perfect cappuccino by Italy’s champion barista.

title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

On the run from a bank robbery that left several police officers dead, Seth Gecko (George Clooney) and his paranoid, loose-cannon brother, Richard (Quentin Tarantino), hightail it to the Mexican border. Kidnapping preacher Jacob Fuller (Harvey Keitel) and his kids, the criminals sneak across the border in the family's RV and hole up in a topless bar. Unfortunately, the bar also happens to be home base for a gang of vampires, and the brothers and their hostages have to fight their way out.

Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location

title: Gente Da Nossa With Nellie Pedro

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Gente da Nossa is a vibrant and engaging weekly Portuguese-language magazine-style show hosted by Nellie Pedro. Airing every Saturday morning on TLN TV, the program serves as a comprehensive and captivating window into the world of Portuguese culture, society, and current affairs captivating its audience by offering thought-provoking interviews with prominent figures in politics, religion, and business, alongside conversations with the most popular entertainers in Portugal. The show provides an insightful and diverse perspective on Portugal through weekly segments shot on location, offering viewers a firsthand look at various aspects of the country. Additionally, Gente da Nossa includes a community bulletin segment, informing audiences about upcoming events and activities happening within the local community.

A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.

title: Il Ladro Di Giorni | Stolen Days

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Salvo is 5 years old when his father Vincenzo gets arrested and put in jail. The kid is sent to live with his uncles in the North-East of Italy, but some years later, once out of prison, Vincenzo shows up again in order to take Salvo back with him. Father and son are perfect strangers and don’t almost recognize each other, but have to start a trip together heading back to southern Italy, where Vincenzo has a task to accomplish. During this long journey sitting in the same car, they will finally face the truth about their relationship, discovering what they really are for each other.
What happens if an always present mother decides to leave for ten days, leaving the three children with a father who was practically absent until then.

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.

A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

This new TLN original documentary series follows celebrated chef and writer Sang Kim on a culinary road trip across his home province. Over the course of six half-hour episodes, Sang travels to meet a colourful, multi-generational cast of Korean Canadians, each with their own unique perspectives and recipes to share.

Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.

Celebrate tastes of the true north with Opening Canada. Join celebrity chef duo Rob Rossi and Craig Harding as they eat their way across their home and native land making stops in The Laurentians, Montreal, Toronto, Saskatoon, the Blue Mountains, Whitehorse and Vancouver to celebrate Canada’s diverse food culture from coast to coast.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!

TLN celebrity chef David Rocco welcomes viewers into his home kitchen in the newest installment of the Dolce series on TLN TV. “Dolce Homemade,” showcases David celebrating multicultural Canada by connecting with friends and family through candid conversations and inspiring recipes. Featuring guests from around the world who share David’s passion for both food and life, the new series brings his adventurous spirit home.

Follow 7 rookie estate agents as they put everything on the line to sell some of the most impressive and exclusive properties in the UK - from Scottish castles to penthouse apartments, seaside mansions to gated estates.

This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Every country has its own flavour, shaped by the local produce, culture, history and bakers that spend their lives making what for many, is a foundation of their diets.

In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.

The final chapter in the “Opening” series features Canadian chefs (and best friends) Rob Rossi and Craig Harding travelling to the island of Sicily for their next culinary adventure. The ancient crossroads of the Mediterranean, this gorgeous island has a dazzling diversity of landscapes and cultural treasures. It also boasts its very own style of traditional Italian cuisine and an increasingly vibrant wine scene.

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location

The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.

A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.

Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

Open Fire is a rustic outdoor cooking series featuring acclaimed Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding creating delicious, innovative dishes over multiple fires. The series spans all four seasons as the Chefs heat things up in the fresh days of spring through to the crisp cold of snowbound winter.

David Rocco’s Dolce Africa tells the lesser-known stories of the world’s oldest continent. From ancient tribal villages and rural working farms, to breathtaking natural parks and big bustling cities, David explores the rich and diverse cultures and culinary worlds of Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar and South Africa with curiosity, an open heart and an open mind. By fully immersing himself and the viewer in the sights, sounds and tastes of Africa, David shatters our preconceived notions of a continent that’s struggling to survive, and instead paints a picture of an Africa that is strong, proud and beautiful — the Africa of the future.

Neven Maguire travels from Venice on the Adriatic Coast, to Sorrento on the Mediterranean, visiting Parma, Modena, Florence and Tuscany. Along the way, Ireland’s hugely popular chef learns about some of the wonderful food and drink that have made Italian cuisine so popular around the world, including parmesan cheese, pasta, Parma ham, Prosecco, olive oil, coffee and Chianti. Neven enjoys street food beside a race track, he is shown how to cook the perfect risotto by a Michelin star chef, and he is taught how to make the perfect cappuccino by Italy’s champion barista.

The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.

David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.

title: Gente Da Nossa With Nellie Pedro

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Gente da Nossa is a vibrant and engaging weekly Portuguese-language magazine-style show hosted by Nellie Pedro. Airing every Saturday morning on TLN TV, the program serves as a comprehensive and captivating window into the world of Portuguese culture, society, and current affairs captivating its audience by offering thought-provoking interviews with prominent figures in politics, religion, and business, alongside conversations with the most popular entertainers in Portugal. The show provides an insightful and diverse perspective on Portugal through weekly segments shot on location, offering viewers a firsthand look at various aspects of the country. Additionally, Gente da Nossa includes a community bulletin segment, informing audiences about upcoming events and activities happening within the local community.

title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.

Find out what is to come in the upcoming round of Serie A in this 30 minute preview show.
Relive the goals and highlights from the previous round of Serie A in this 30 minute recap show.

TLN celebrity chef David Rocco welcomes viewers into his home kitchen in the newest installment of the Dolce series on TLN TV. “Dolce Homemade,” showcases David celebrating multicultural Canada by connecting with friends and family through candid conversations and inspiring recipes. Featuring guests from around the world who share David’s passion for both food and life, the new series brings his adventurous spirit home.

The final chapter in the “Opening” series features Canadian chefs (and best friends) Rob Rossi and Craig Harding travelling to the island of Sicily for their next culinary adventure. The ancient crossroads of the Mediterranean, this gorgeous island has a dazzling diversity of landscapes and cultural treasures. It also boasts its very own style of traditional Italian cuisine and an increasingly vibrant wine scene.

Open Fire is a rustic outdoor cooking series featuring acclaimed Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding creating delicious, innovative dishes over multiple fires. The series spans all four seasons as the Chefs heat things up in the fresh days of spring through to the crisp cold of snowbound winter.

This new TLN original documentary series follows celebrated chef and writer Sang Kim on a culinary road trip across his home province. Over the course of six half-hour episodes, Sang travels to meet a colourful, multi-generational cast of Korean Canadians, each with their own unique perspectives and recipes to share.

A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!

In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.

With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.

This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Every country has its own flavour, shaped by the local produce, culture, history and bakers that spend their lives making what for many, is a foundation of their diets.

Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.

Amazing food and great conversation are served up in the new series Silvia's Italian Table featuring Australian actress, opera singer, author and chef Silvia Colloca. Joined by a diverse and eclectic group of celebrity guests including former Olympians Ian Thorpe, Duchess of York Sarah Ferguson, renowned journalist and presenter George Negus, acclaimed chef Matt Moran and actress Marta Dusseldorp,  Silvia shares her personal memories and inspiration behind each mouth-watering dish and visits some of the most stunning parts of Italy.

On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

Follow 7 rookie estate agents as they put everything on the line to sell some of the most impressive and exclusive properties in the UK - from Scottish castles to penthouse apartments, seaside mansions to gated estates.
Two men, six meals in six different places on a road trip around Italy. Liguria, Tuscany, Rome, Amalfi and ending in Capri.

A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action by attempting to liberate a presidential campaign worker and an underage prostitute.

Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.

title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: Join Diane as she travels throughout Greece and its islands, where she explores many of the foods that Greece is known for (olive oil, feta, honey, yogurt and more), and discovers the country's traditions. Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.

title: La Donna Della Mia Vita | The Woman Of My Life

chapterPointCustomProperties.value: The story of two brothers, Leonardo and Giorgio, with opposite personalities. Leonardo is reliable and sensitive, Giorgio is erratic and a womanizer. Their mother, Alba, who has a tendency to be overly controlling, tries to keep them together. She succeeds, at least until the day Giorgio discovers that Leonardo’s new fiancee Sara is none other than his former lover, to whom he shamelessly lied, even telling her that he had a son. From that moment on everything changes: feelings, relationships, and what once seemed like order become utter chaos – until, as always, Alba can restore harmony in the family. But not before twists and surprises.
To avoid losing her home to foreclosure, single mother Angela Logan (Kimberly Elise) tries to bake and sell 100 apple cakes in 10 days.

David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!

Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
